results.title: Problem solving strategies the synectics approach
results.brief_description: Everyone has great creative potential but most of us do not use this because we are afraid of making mistakes. Certain strategies have been developed at Synthetics to overcome self-censoring. In the film we see some strategies in action during a Problem Solving Laboratory session.

results.title: Problem solving & decision making
results.creator_credit: Leslie Hill and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description: This film examines the question, how do human beings make decisions and solve problems. It identifies and explains the two types of reasoning which have been identified as deduction anf induction. The differences between decision making and problem solving are defined as is the effect of bias. Some of the applications of improved understanding of these processes are identified.

results.title: Problem solving
results.brief_description: Problems exists in the day to day operations of all organisations and effective solution is what business is all about. Identifying the problem is easy, however analysis of the problem once identified is not so easy. This short program and trainer’s manual concisely identifies 5 problem solving tools; fault tree analysis, force field analysis, cause/effect analysis, repetitive analysis and sequence of events analysis and outlines which methods are the most applicable to different situations.

results.title: Problem of acceptance
results.brief_description: A condensation of the therapy session held with patients of the psychiatric ward of the University of Oregon Medical School. The theme is a psychodramtic exploration of a 17 year old girl’s attempt to deal with her homosexuality.

results.title: Problem Drinkers
results.brief_description: The story of what is being done in America to control alcoholism. The film follows, step by step, an alcoholic’s downfall and his eventual rehabilitation.

results.title: Problem clinic
results.creator_credit: Ronald Weyman, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Few people, faced with the complicated machinery of the law, know how to proceed without legal counsel or defence. Yet many are unable to pay for the services of a lawyer. The Law Societies of many of the provinces, encouraged by the Canadian Bar Association, extend help in the form of free legal-aid clinics staffed by volunteer lawyers. Enacted here is a case in which a young man facing a criminal charge is defended by a legal-aid lawyer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald Weyman, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Probing the continental margin
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes the techniques of coring, trailing and seismic sounding used by scientists to survey and explore the mineral content of undersea landforms around Australia’s continental margin.

results.title: Probation officer
results.creator_credit: J.B. Holmes, Donald Alexander and Data Film Productions
results.brief_description: A study of the cast cope of duties which Probation Officers are called upon to perform; the case of a young girl is presented. Because she is unhappy at home, she seeks satisfaction elsewhere, gets into bad company and is convicted of stealing. Through the understanding and help of the Probation Officer, he girl’s home life is improved, and the girl is put on probation instead of being sent to gaol. The purpose of the film is to encourage recruitment of suitable people to the probation service; their training is shown , and the necessary educational requirements indicated.

results.title: Probability (Rajah)
